bow: months of breastmilk production going back to work tomorrow have managed to freeze over 500 ounces of breastmilk and feed my baby who is 99th percentile in height and 90th percentile in weight did not have large boobs before and struggled in the beginning with production but surpassed my goal so to all the mommies out there you got this this might have made me cry when was pumping times day to get enough to feed lo for the time was at work then feeding on demand when we were at home want everyone to know that this huge amount of frozen milk is not necessary to succeed after pumping at work for nine months had roughly 250oz frozen so that could stop pumping month early and make it to the one year mark it got much better when lo started eating solids but for those who really are just scraping by you can do it this is amazing it incredibly difficult for many people to create huge stash like this but it will give you lot of flexibility when you return to work have some upcoming travel and have to do middle of the night pumps to build up my stash more since produce just enough for her needs every day be aware milk in deep freeze only is fresh for months you may want to start donating some of that to another family great job momma this is the supply hoped for with both my babes both times had like 10 or so bags of milk month into returning to work so going on date or something was never frequent option you can go on vacation you re rock star hope your first day back is smooth for everyone this is amazing at what point after having the baby did you start pumping just had my baby and the lactation consultant said for the first weeks should only focus on feeding the baby and not worry about pumping the baby will be months old when return to work milk in deep freeze can be stored for at least nine months and after that it begins to lose nutrients but doesn go bad it can be stored up to year and again even at year it doesn become contaminated or harmful it just may begin to lose nutritive value but after year your baby is likely getting nutrients from variety of sources so imagine it would be unlikely to cause any kind of deficiency https breastfeeding support how long does breast milk last was remembering the guidelines from my year old glad they made it longer when my oldest was small there was so little information swear don think anyone recommended more than few days remember taking milk from my pump and packing it in snow while pulled over during snow squall because had been told that freshly pumped milk couldn be unchilled for more than few minutes haha the first weeks are baby establishing your supply pumping during that time can give you overproduction which sounds ok but it can come with consequences like mastitis clogged ducts heavier letdown and you having to pump even when baby is satisfied not sure when you have to go back to work but you dont need huge freezer stash though that awesome op you just need to pump enough for the next day while you re away from baby so yeah wait at least weeks post partum if you can damn could never get my supply up like that good bewbs am going back to work in months can ask how you accomplished this what was your pumping feeding routine thank you had supply issues with my first so had been obsessing over this throughout my pregnancy it was such relief to hear the lactation consultant say that didn need to worry about it yet know we operate under the best information we have at anytime but damn that really stressful the hospital lactation consultant suggested the same advice to me but she stressed pumping would confuse baby well my dd wouldn latch properly and my supply wasn coming in she lost too much weight too soon it was the pediatrician who disagreed and said to pump right away that pumping helps your supply kick in faster after pumped we never had another issue dd is beautifully chubby and happy this is my first baby and hardly an expert but say pump while nursing that the advice got most often and had lot of moms say they could control production by frequency so pumped exclusively after about 10 days after birth my dd wouldn latch properly read lot of advice and here what did stuck to hour interval think the first week two there were many hour intervals when was barely producing enough for her to eat kept the four hour schedule at night too that was rough my husband handled night feedings so that could be on opposite schedule and don pump both boobs simultaneously pump one at time and don leave the pump on one—i alternate in order to encourage another let down and of course massage press it takes about 20 30 minutes also found the pump is stronger with one pump instead of two did the cookies for about month think they help give boost but aren necessary permanently hope this is helpful good luck to you damn mama so proud of you that really interesting never tried doing one side at time exclusively pumped when my daughter was
